meanings.definition: To join or attach by stitches
meanings.sent1: She carefully sewed the buttons onto the shirt.
meanings.sent2: My grandma taught me how to sew a patch on my jeans.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to sew its toy mouse back together with tiny stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her words sewed a sense of unity among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The golden thread sewn through the fabric sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The sewn hem on the dress looked neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: I found a sewn label inside the jacket with the designer's name.
meanings.sent3: The sewn edges of the quilt formed a colorful pattern.
meanings.sent4: His sewn initials on the handkerchief made it a personalized gift.
meanings.sent5: The sewn seams of the bag were strong and durable.
